comments.text:
+Wynter Schroeder do yourself a favor and get a complete from a shop or 
website, for the money they cost they will outlast the walmart one years 
and once you are ready to try tricks you already have the board for it. FYI 
I bought one of those for my 60 lbs nephew and he destroyed it in a couple 
of hours, just saying if it won't take the abuse from an 8yo probably not 
good for you.
comments.author: Ira Dutary-Audia (Papo)

comments.text: +TheMrDicat Yeah! Thanks Let The Skating Begin!

very easily,but it should be good enough for you to start!
Good luck,and most importantly,have fun!
comments.author: TheMrDicat

comments.text:
+TheMrDicat Ok Thanks! I'm 12 so I really can't buy a 40$$ board but 
there's some at Walmart! For about 15-20$$ I'm joining the girl skate club 
I guess! For all the girls that skate
comments.author: Wynter Schroeder

comments.text:
+Wynter Schroeder If you have the money,yes!
A revive deck,for example(Revive is a company from the guy that made this 
video) costs 37 dollars+9 dollars of shipping!

You just need to know the size!You should get a 7.5/7.75/7.8 or 
8.0,anything bigger than that are made for ramps,bowls,etc!
A 7.75 should be good enough!
comments.author: TheMrDicat

comments.text:
+TheMrDicat Ok Thanks! One more question! My board is kinda old I've had it 
for about 5 years and when I get on it. It kinda cracks! A lil. Should I 
get a new one?
comments.author: Wynter Schroeder

comments.text:
+Wynter Schroeder Just find a smooth ground and try riding!I was also 
really scared when I started and after I fell I realized it really wasn't 
as scary as though!I would fall on my butt,get up and try again!

Here's some tips!
It is nice to ride near a wall,'cause you'll have something to hold on to!
Keep your front foot near the first 2 front bolts and your back foot on 
your tail,always keep your weight on your front foot only,unless you want 
to do something with your tail!

Something I did before learning how to push was standing on the board and 
pushing myself from a wall with my hands!That way I would always have both 
of my feet on the board and it was easier to balance myself!After I was 
confortable with riding and started trying to push with my feet!

I reccomend you watching ''Skateboarding Made Simple Volume 1'' by Aaron 
Kyro!He's a professional skateboarder and a really good teacher,he really 
helped me out!
comments.author: TheMrDicat

comments.text:
+TheMrDicat dont know how to push and ride! I don't wanna fall and break 
something that's why I'm scared to actouly skate
comments.author: Wynter Schroeder

comments.text:
+Wynter Schroeder It is all about practice!When turning like that,make sure 
not to touch the tail on the ground!
Do you know how to push and ride?
You should learn how to push,ride and turn(by leaning) before trying to 
learn anything else!
comments.author: TheMrDicat

comments.text:
+TheMrDicat Oh Ok..... Thanks that helps! I was kinda turning in circles 
one day on my board And I did a Manual while turning
comments.author: Wynter Schroeder

comments.text:
+Wynter Schroeder You when turning?By tapping your front wheels?
If so,when you put pressure with your back foot on the tail,twist your 
shoulders to the side you want to turn and then your legs to the same 
side!Make sure to turn your shoulders and then your legs,not exactly at the 
same time!
comments.author: TheMrDicat

comments.text:
+TheMrDicat Oh Sorry! Like I can only move the Tail and not the nose so 
much and its hard to skate because I do the weird footed thing than normal 
people use to skate like the position!
comments.author: Wynter Schroeder

comments.text:
I don't understand your question!
Btw,the ''front tail'' is called ''Nose'' and the ''back tail'' is called 
''Tail''

I really want to buy a skateboard and was planning on getting a regular one 
but my brother just said to me that longboards are much better for 
beginners. After looking into it I read that longboards are bigger, easier 
for beginners because of that extra space and faster but you can't do the 
typical skateboarding tricks on them easily. I want to be able to get on my 
skateboard and go somewhere but I still want to be able to try out tricks 
(easy-intermediate, I'm not looking to grind on staircase rails or 
anything...). Should I be getting a skateboard, longboard or short 
longboard (or something else)?

sorry I know that's long :/﻿

comments.author: Wynter Schroeder

comments.text:
Skateboarding and longboarding are basically two different beasts all 
together. If you want to skateboard(which i recommend) then it's best just 
to get a skateboard and look for your local skatepark. Personally, I think 
concrete parks are the easiest to learn on because you get used to a 
real-life terrain that is much more smoother. So once you learn how to get 
used to it cruising along rougher terrain comes natural.
comments.author: Rambi

comments.text: Get a regular skateboard with soft wheels for cruising and tricks
comments.author: ascension54321

comments.text:
Dude! Just get yourself a regular board. I mean from my point of view, it 
will suit your needs. Of course that being, "cruising and trying out 
easy-intermediate tricks". But then again I don't know, maybe if you told 
 a shop assistant at the nearest skate shop what you wanted, he/she might 
give you better advice than me. But I say go for a regular board.

Do it on grass.﻿

comments.text:
Ugh, it looks so easy, but trying it is very difficult.. 
I would LOVE to skateboard with my friends but it's discouraging that I 
can't even ride one. Every time I push my self to move more I feel like I'm 
going to fall forward. ﻿

comments.text:

comments.text:
Hey guys I am not sure if I should start skateboarding and was wondering if 
it was worth getting a board and if it is a cool hobby?﻿
comments.author: Yonas Campbell

comments.text:
Fair enough cheers I will start within the next few months, or as soon as I 
get a board. Thanks again for the advice. How often do you skate?
comments.author: Yonas Campbell

comments.text:
Skateboard if you think you can stay committed, because if you try and give 
up you will never like it again , if you commit and get through it, it will 
be the greatest feeling, so its about staying committed not about how fun 
it will get or not, but its really fun and ive been skateboarding for about 
a year and i have alot down
comments.author: Piggy Piggy

comments.text: I play tennis and game as well

comments.text:
I dont skate, I want to. Ive heard its like a huge hobby. I like playing 
soccer, tennis and gaming but I want to skate and it turns out it can 
actually be a big hobby and its good as its way to get sunshine and fit
comments.author: With3red_China R1sinG

comments.text:
I feel comfortable pushing goofy, but when I stand on the board I feel 
awkward. I feel a lot comfortable standing regular but pushing with my left 
foot feels wrong. Which stance should I ride does anyone have any tips.﻿
comments.author: Unspoken Triumph

comments.text:
He says how you feel comfortable like if you like goofy do it or if you 
like regular.
